column2: Michele Dauber is a bully who makes disparaging remarks & makes threatening tweets. She is a bully.  Contrary to what she says she blocks anyone that disagrees with her.
column26: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford
column33: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford
column34: Michele Dauber, a professor at Stanford University has taken to Twitter to express her discuss for Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez.  Although everyone has the right to express their opinions on the outcome of the trial and their opinions of the lawyers for either sides, Michele Dauber has taken it too far! She is evidently in support of Amber Heard, but her blatant degrading of Ms. Vasquez has crossed the line of disagreeing with her professional abilities to downright publicly degrading her as a person and as a woman. Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! Stanford needs to remove Michelle Dauber from their staff!

column2:
This woman is the most vile,disgraceful person . She is not a feminist by any rights,I'm not sure what she could be labeled. She instigates students ,threatens students and  been cause physical and emotional damage to students. Her online presence is disgusting, constantly threatening, bullying, and talking foul filth. And yes she has said awful things about Stanford as well. I cannot understand how a once reputable institution can maintain a person like her on their staff. Unless she has the ability to blackmail someone there and that's why she is kept. I have three sons and five grandchildren,I hope none of them ever make the choice to go to Stanford . And that's sad because I have a granddaughter who works her tail off to maintain a 4.0 gpa at the hopes of attending a prestigious university,as her desire in to pursue politics on the congressional level. 
I believe more parents will be looking towards other universities as long as Michelle dauber is allowed to be on staff.

column2: As a public face of Stanford, she is posting harassing and disparaging messages to social media. She claims to represent or advocate for survivors of domestic abuse and sexual abuse; however, she has cookie cutter, one size fits all idea of what a survivor should be. If a survivor doesn't match this idea, their less than other survivors. Her follows are telling survivors their not "real" or that they've never encountered predatory men. Ms. Dauber is posting images of white vans that says free candy. I realize her intent is towards one individual here, but as a survivor of childhood sexual assault, this is triggering. She is also attacking minority female lawyers because of who they represented instead of applauding their achievements. Is this the type of behavior that Stanford stands for? The face of Stanford is full of hate, vitriol, and vengeance towards men, students, and anyone who doesn't met the standard set for survivorship and feminism. As long as Ms. Dauber is allowed to continue posting as a public figure of Stanford  without disciplinary action, that is exactly what Stanford stands for!

column34: Michele Dauber, a professor at Stanford University has taken to Twitter to express her discuss for Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez.  Although everyone has the right to express their opinions on the outcome of the trial and their opinions of the lawyers for either sides, Michele Dauber has taken it too far! She is evidently in support of Amber Heard, but her blatant degrading of Ms. Vasquez has crossed the line of disagreeing with her professional abilities to downright publicly degrading her as a person and as a woman. Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! She is evidently in support of Amber Heard, but her blatant degrading of Ms. Vasquez has crossed the line of disagreeing with her professional abilities to downright publicly degrading her as a person and as a woman. Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! Stanford needs to remove Michelle Dauber from their staff!

column2: This "woman" has no moral ethics to be any professor at any college or be around young adults, she is opinionated and vile and shows no class. I wouldn't send my child to standford just for her being present
column26: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford
column33: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford
column34: Michele Dauber, a professor at Stanford University has taken to Twitter to express her discuss for Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez.  Although everyone has the right to express their opinions on the outcome of the trial and their opinions of the lawyers for either sides, Michele Dauber has taken it too far! She is evidently in support of Amber Heard, but her blatant degrading of Ms. Vasquez has crossed the line of disagreeing with her professional abilities to downright publicly degrading her as a person and as a woman. Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! Stanford needs to remove Michelle Dauber from their staff!
column36: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford

column2: harassing young women online in the name of feminism?.... Using men as a stage to harass young women on Twitter?......
column26: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford
column33: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford
column34: Michele Dauber, a professor at Stanford University has taken to Twitter to express her discuss for Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez.  Although everyone has the right to express their opinions on the outcome of the trial and their opinions of the lawyers for either sides, Michele Dauber has taken it too far! She is evidently in support of Amber Heard, but her blatant degrading of Ms. Vasquez has crossed the line of disagreeing with her professional abilities to downright publicly degrading her as a person and as a woman. Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! Stanford needs to remove Michelle Dauber from their staff!

column142: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford

column2: Young minds full of anticipation & expectation attend Stanford University. Like seedlings & hanging on every word, thought & tried idea; they fill themselves with information in hopes of one day blooming into self-reliant, productive members of society with hopes of making real differences in the world. However, when doing so, if ideas are taught even slightly slanted or so passively, like a grain at a time, this will effect the chemistry of thought…especially when looking to fit in & belong, especially by an out spoken prof. Would an opposing point of view effect how different members of the student body are seen, graded or would students be by-passed for opportunities because they don’t fit within the realms of her thinking? In a perfect world this question would be a resounding & unequivocally NO! But we don’t live in a perfect world & EVEN if this individual believes that her emotions on this matter are not influencing how she teaches, I can guarantee that this is absolutely not the case, good intentions or not. The passions of teaching run deep as deep as this subject matter, is it possible to keep them separate when she is slandering Mr Depp on social media then attending to class after? Is it possible not to let your own conclusions taint the excellent  work put forth from the University? Take examples from Roe vs Wade…how hard is it for Judges to remain unbiased? Has anyone ever heard a Judge break this rule? Everyone knows the answer to that & I personally have heard of Judges being censured over that subject- in Canada. Stanford keep your higher grade of learning at its best & release this lower grade of teaching away from your students, campus & faculty - make her an example of what you expect when one is employed by your exemplary University.

column2: This woman is disgusting. I saw just a few things she tweeted, but that was enough for me. The WAY she is "fighting for women rights" is just not correct. I am not, what you call, a Fan of JD, but in that moment i heard about the "Abuse" i KNEW he didn't do it to her. And yes, i did watch the most of the Trial because of Interest. And now here comes this Woman and is posting those bad and so absolute wrong Things. This is stupid. It clearly seems to me that she is claiming for "15 Minutes of Fame". What else would it be though? Sorry, but a healthy Brain would've seen that JD as a MAN is the Victim and should be supported by a Person of her Interest. This is so wrong!!! So i am with all those people who wants her removed from Stanford on this Position! Just because he is a man he is not allowed to have rights? What is her point though? She is a Sexist and nothing more!

column2: She is not a professional and it does not look good for your university. I never though I would see a university allow a teacher to act so terrible on a social media platform and still have their jobs. Shame on you for not doing something. We are aware that her husband works for google and you may be intimidated.  It is your job to make sure she is held to higher standards. I know Notre Dame would never allow this
column26: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford
column33: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford
column34: Michele Dauber, a professor at Stanford University has taken to Twitter to express her discuss for Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez.  Although everyone has the right to express their opinions on the outcome of the trial and their opinions of the lawyers for either sides, Michele Dauber has taken it too far! She is evidently in support of Amber Heard, but her blatant degrading of Ms. Vasquez has crossed the line of disagreeing with her professional abilities to downright publicly degrading her as a person and as a woman. Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! Stanford needs to remove Michelle Dauber from their staff!
column36: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford

column34: Michele Dauber, a professor at Stanford University has taken to Twitter to express her discuss for Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez.  Although everyone has the right to express their opinions on the outcome of the trial and their opinions of the lawyers for either sides, Michele Dauber has taken it too far! She is evidently in support of Amber Heard, but her blatant degrading of Ms. Vasquez has crossed the line of disagreeing with her professional abilities to downright publicly degrading her as a person and as a woman. Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! Stanford needs to remove Michelle Dauber from their staff!

column142: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford

column2:
Firmo esta petición, porque me parece increíble que una supuesta "profesional" incentive una conducta tan horrible como el bullying. Y lo que me parece más horrible de la situación, es que esta señora se burle de Johnny, un hombre que es víctima de violencia doméstica. Nada justifica el bullying, y menos cuando un hombre pudo por fin salir a contarle al mundo la verdad, cuando sufrió 6 años de difamaciones, malos tratos, discriminación, perdió su carrera y su vida en manos de una señora que le arruinó la vida porque se le dio la gana, y encima entonces, está la señora profesora que se burla y lo persigue de forma obsesiva! Ya basta!! La violencia no tiene género, el bullying tampoco y no hay razón alguna para burlarse de absolutamente nadie!
El respeto es para todos!

column2: Michele dauber is a sexiest racist nasty woman who is contanstantly throwing abuse around everyday towards depp and anyone involved with depp the tweets she does are shocking and very triggering to men and woman please have her removed as staff at stanford think of her students the trauma she causes them
column26: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford
column33: Remove Michele Dauber as a professor from Stanford
column34: Michele Dauber, a professor at Stanford University has taken to Twitter to express her discuss for Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez.  Although everyone has the right to express their opinions on the outcome of the trial and their opinions of the lawyers for either sides, Michele Dauber has taken it too far! She is evidently in support of Amber Heard, but her blatant degrading of Ms. Vasquez has crossed the line of disagreeing with her professional abilities to downright publicly degrading her as a person and as a woman. Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! Stanford needs to remove Michelle Dauber from their staff!

Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! Stanford needs to remove Michelle Dauber from their staff!

column2: Michele Dauber has crossed all lines. As a Stanford prof she clearly uses hate speech and degrades women. Being in the law field she should know that she can be sued and would not only tarnish her name but the name of Stanford University. Her remarks are vile, racist, unprofessional, unethical, painful and irresponsible. It is alright to support one party but definitely not correct to degrade and defame the party you don’t support. An example needs to be set by removing her. Enough is enough!

column34: Michele Dauber, a professor at Stanford University has taken to Twitter to express her discuss for Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez.  Although everyone has the right to express their opinions on the outcome of the trial and their opinions of the lawyers for either sides, Michele Dauber has taken it too far! She is evidently in support of Amber Heard, but her blatant degrading of Ms. Vasquez has crossed the line of disagreeing with her professional abilities to downright publicly degrading her as a person and as a woman. Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! Stanford needs to remove Michelle Dauber from their staff!

column34: Michele Dauber, a professor at Stanford University has taken to Twitter to express her discuss for Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez.  Although everyone has the right to express their opinions on the outcome of the trial and their opinions of the lawyers for either sides, Michele Dauber has taken it too far! She is evidently in support of Amber Heard, but her blatant degrading of Ms. Vasquez has crossed the line of disagreeing with her professional abilities to downright publicly degrading her as a person and as a woman. Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! Stanford needs to remove Michelle Dauber from their staff!

column34: Michele Dauber, a professor at Stanford University has taken to Twitter to express her discuss for Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez.  Although everyone has the right to express their opinions on the outcome of the trial and their opinions of the lawyers for either sides, Michele Dauber has taken it too far! She is evidently in support of Amber Heard, but her blatant degrading of Ms. Vasquez has crossed the line of disagreeing with her professional abilities to downright publicly degrading her as a person and as a woman. Her name calling and public railroading the ability of Ms. Vasquez is not only defamation of character but also unprofessional and unsubstantiated.  As a professor at Stanford University, this is unacceptable behavior that Stanford should not tolerate from a member of their staff.  If this was a male professor and he would have referred to woman as "skirts", he would have immediately have been reprimanded and promptly removed from his position. Johnny Depp's entire case was literally based on exactly this same issue: women can abuse anyone physically or emotionally and get away with it, but if a man does anything remotely the same, they are put in front of a firing squad in the media and the world. Let's not allow this to happen once again! Michelle Dauber should be held accountable the same way one of her male peers would if he would have publicly degraded and viciously went after Ms. Vasquez.  Let's make sure our voices are heard that we aren't going to tolerate this kind of behavior from anyone,  male or female! Stanford needs to remove Michelle Dauber from their staff!
